metadata.Title: CVE-2022-25235 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
xmltok_impl.c in Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.5 lacks certain validation of encoding, such as checks for whether a UTF-8 character is valid in a certain context.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-25235` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm2
lib64expat1 - 2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm2
libexpat1 - 2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

libxmltok1 - 1.2-3ubuntu0.16.04.1~esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: sbeattie> paraview uses system expat xotcl uses system expat poco uses system expat gdcm uses system expat audacity uses system expat simgear uses system expat coin3 uses system expat as of 4.0.0~CMake~6f54f1602475+ds1-1 sitecopy uses system expat since 1:0.16.0-1 (dapper!)

criterions.comment: ayttm package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
cableswig package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.

coin3 package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.

firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').

libxmltok package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2-3ubuntu0.16.04.1~esm2').

vnc4 package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
vtk package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
